## FFT in R using the cfp package

This document present the basic fft functions 

```{r}
library(data.table, warn.conflicts = FALSE)
library(plotly, warn.conflicts = FALSE)
library(cfp, warn.conflicts = FALSE)
```

## compute the convolution of two random variables

```{r}
flags <- create.fft.flag('estimate')
plan  <- create.fft.plan(flags, size=1000)
df    <- data.table(x=rnorm(1000), y=rnorm(1000))

df[, conv:=cfp::convolution(plan, x, y)]

plot_ly(df, y=~conv, type='scatter', mode='marks')

```

Note that the `echo = FALSE` parameter was added to the code chunk to prevent printing of the R code that generated the plot.
